title: Courts Order Trump Admin to Fund SNAP; Admin Offers Partial Benefits
snippets: Two judges have ordered the Trump administration to fund SNAP benefits. And, New York City voters head to the polls tomorrow to choose between Zohran Mamdani and former Gov. Andrew Cuomo in the mayoral race.
Trump administration says SNAP will be partially funded in November AP News
Live updates: Trump administration says SNAP will be partially funded after judges’ rulings AP News
The country's flagship food aid scheme serves one in eight Americans each month.
Trump administration plan to partially fund SNAP benefits could take months Axios

The Trump administration says it will restart the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program, but will only pay half the amount people usually get. The move comes after two federal judges ruled that freezing payments for the U.S.'s biggest anti-hunger program is unlawful.
Trump Administration Says Food Aid Will Be Partially Funded Bloomberg.com
The government says an emergency fund it will use has $4.65 billion — enough to cover about half the normal benefits.
titles: Judge says Trump administration must fund SNAP. And, what to know about NYC's election
Trump administration says SNAP will be partially funded in November - AP News
Live updates: Trump administration says SNAP will be partially funded after judges’ rulings - AP News
Trump administration to partially fund SNAP food benefits amid US shutdown
Trump administration plan to partially fund SNAP benefits could take months - Axios
Trump administration will partially restore food benefit funding after judges’ ruling
Trump Administration Says Food Aid Will Be Partially Funded - Bloomberg.com
Trump administration to partially fund SNAP this month after judges order use of emergency reserves
summary: Two federal judges have ordered the Trump administration to continue funding the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP), the U.S.'s largest anti-hunger initiative. Following this, the administration announced plans to partially fund SNAP, providing half the usual benefits to the one in eight Americans it serves monthly. This decision utilizes an emergency fund with $4.65 billion, which is expected to cover about half of the normal benefits. Meanwhile, New York City voters are preparing to choose between Zohran Mamdani and former Gov. Andrew Cuomo in the mayoral race.

title: Worker Dies After Rescue from Rubble Near Rome's Colosseum
snippets: Rome firefighters rescue worker trapped under collapsed medieval tower Reuters
The man was trapped for several hours after part of the Torre dei Conti, on the edge of the famous Roman Forum, gave way.
Video shows part of Rome’s medieval Torre dei Conti collapse for a second time during restoration near the Colosseum
One worker was critically injured and another trapped in the collapse, authorities said.

Romanian worker taken to hospital in ‘serious condition’ after being saved from Torre dei Conti rubble A Romanian worker who was trapped for hours under rubble in Rome after the partial collapse of a medieval tower near the Colosseum was rescued by emergency services on Monday night, local authoriti
Rescuers at the tower near the Colosseum worked for 11 hours before removing the man who had been pinned under rubble and debris. He later died in the hospital.
titles: Rome firefighters rescue worker trapped under collapsed medieval tower - Reuters
Worker pulled from partially collapsed medieval tower in Rome
Worker trapped after medieval Rome tower partially collapses
WATCH:  Medieval tower partially collapses in Rome
Rescuers free man trapped in partly collapsed medieval tower in Rome
Medieval Tower in Rome Partially Collapses, Trapping Worker Who Died After Rescue Efforts
summary: In Rome, a Romanian worker was trapped under the rubble of the partially collapsed medieval Torre dei Conti near the Colosseum. After an 11-hour rescue operation, firefighters successfully freed the man, who had been critically injured. Despite their efforts, he later died in the hospital due to his injuries.

title: Kimberly-Clark Buys Tylenol Maker Kenvue for $40B Amid Autism Dispute
snippets: One of the biggest mergers of the year, worth $49 billion, comes just weeks after the Trump administration linked the common painkiller to autism, which the company is fighting.
Kimberly-Clark bets $40 billion for Kenvue despite Tylenol controversy Reuters
The deal has analysts puzzled, as the US maker of Tylenol has seen sales dip after the White House linked it to autism.
Huggies maker Kimberly-Clark to buy Tylenol maker Kenvue for $40 billion Axios
The combined company would bring together brands like Huggies and Kleenex with the likes of Band-Aid and Tylenol.
Kimberly-Clark Is Buying Tylenol Maker Kenvue for Nearly $49B. Here's What You Need to Know Investopedia
Kimberly-Clark to Buy Tylenol Maker Kenvue for $40 Billion Bloomberg.com
titles: Huggies maker Kimberly-Clark is buying Tylenol maker Kenvue
Kimberly-Clark bets $40 billion for Kenvue despite Tylenol controversy - Reuters
Kimberly-Clark to buy Tylenol maker Kenvue for $40bn
Huggies maker Kimberly-Clark to buy Tylenol maker Kenvue for $40 billion - Axios
Kimberly-Clark agrees to buy Tylenol owner Kenvue in $48.7 billion deal, creating consumer staples giant
Kimberly-Clark Is Buying Tylenol Maker Kenvue for Nearly $49B. Here's What You Need to Know - Investopedia
Kimberly-Clark to Buy Tylenol Maker Kenvue for $40 Billion - Bloomberg.com
summary: Kimberly-Clark has agreed to purchase Kenvue, the maker of Tylenol, for $40 billion, despite recent controversies linking Tylenol to autism, which Kenvue is disputing. This merger, one of the year's largest, combines Kimberly-Clark's portfolio, including Huggies and Kleenex, with Kenvue's brands like Band-Aid and Tylenol. The acquisition occurs amid declining Tylenol sales following the autism allegations by the Trump administration.

title: OpenAI Signs $38B Cloud Deal with Amazon, Shifts from Microsoft
snippets: OpenAI turns to Amazon in $38 billion cloud services deal after restructuring Reuters
Microsoft signs $9.7 billion cloud deal with IREN as AI demand swells Reuters
The announcement comes less than week after Amazon laid off 14,000 people.
OpenAI will immediately begin tapping Nvidia's AI processors using infrastructure from Amazon Web Services.
Amazon Inks $38 Billion Deal With OpenAI for Nvidia Chips Bloomberg.com
US Stocks Extend Bull Run as Amazon Inks $38 Billion OpenAI Deal Bloomberg.com
Lossmaking start-up commits to spending close to $1.5tn as it gobbles up processing power
Amazon's Stock Climbs to Fresh High on $38B Cloud Computing Deal With OpenAI Investopedia

OpenAI isn't done securing the AI infrastructure it needs to rapidly scale agentic workloads. The ChatGPT maker on Monday said it has reached a deal with Amazon to buy $38 billion in cloud computing services over the next seven years.
Deal will provide access to hundreds of thousands of Nvidia chips that power ChatGPT.
The agreement comes less than a week after OpenAI altered its partnership with its longtime backer Microsoft, which until early this year was the startup's exclusive cloud computing provider.
titles: OpenAI turns to Amazon in $38 billion cloud services deal after restructuring - Reuters
Microsoft signs $9.7 billion cloud deal with IREN as AI demand swells - Reuters
OpenAI, Amazon sign $38bn AI deal
Amazon closes at record after $38 billion OpenAI deal with AWS
Amazon Inks $38 Billion Deal With OpenAI for Nvidia Chips - Bloomberg.com
US Stocks Extend Bull Run as Amazon Inks $38 Billion OpenAI Deal - Bloomberg.com
OpenAI strikes $38bn computing deal with Amazon
Amazon's Stock Climbs to Fresh High on $38B Cloud Computing Deal With OpenAI - Investopedia
OpenAI and Amazon ink $38B cloud computing deal
OpenAI signs massive AI compute deal with Amazon
OpenAI signs $38 billion deal to power AI tools with ‘hundred of thousands’ of Nvidia chips via Amazon Web Services
summary: OpenAI has signed a $38 billion deal with Amazon for cloud computing services, shifting from its previous exclusive provider, Microsoft. This agreement, announced shortly after Amazon laid off 14,000 employees, will last seven years, granting OpenAI access to Nvidia's AI processors through Amazon Web Services. This move comes as OpenAI seeks to expand its AI infrastructure for scaling its operations, including the ChatGPT platform. Additionally, Microsoft has secured a $9.7 billion cloud deal with IREN amid rising AI demand. Following the announcement, Amazon's stock reached a new high.

title: Diane Ladd, Oscar-Nominated Actress, Dies at 89
snippets: "We were blessed to have her," said her daughter, actress Laura Dern. The two acted together in many films and the HBO show Enlightened.
Diane Ladd, 3-time Oscar nominee, dies at 89 AP News

The death of the three-time Oscar nominee, whose starred in films including Chinatown, was announced by her daughter Laura Dern Oscar-nominated actor Diane Ladd has died at the age of 89. The actor, whose credits included Alice Doesn’t Live Here Anymore, Chinatown and National Lampoon’s Christmas Va
Diane Ladd, the three-time Academy Award nominee whose roles ranged from the brash waitress in Alice Doesn't Live Here Anymore to the scheming parent in Wild at Heart, has died at 89.
Diane Ladd, the three-time Academy Award–nominated actress whose career spanned more than six decades, died Monday. She was 89.
titles: Oscar-nominated US actress Diane Ladd dies at 89
Diane Ladd, 3-time Oscar nominee, dies at 89 - AP News
Diane Ladd, Oscar-nominated actor of Alice Doesn’t Live Here Anymore, dies aged 89
3-time Oscar nominee Diane Ladd dead at 89
Diane Ladd, Oscar-Nominated Actress And Mother Of Laura Dern, Dies At 89
summary: Diane Ladd, a celebrated actress known for her roles in films like "Chinatown" and "Alice Doesn’t Live Here Anymore," has passed away at the age of 89. Her death was announced by her daughter, actress Laura Dern, with whom she had acted in several films and the HBO show "Enlightened." Ladd was a three-time Oscar nominee over her six-decade career.

title: Dodgers Win Second Straight World Series, Beat Blue Jays in Game 7
snippets: Celebrating fans took to the streets in Los Angeles as the Dodgers won their second consecutive World Series.

Throngs of people took to the streets, and Dodger Stadium, to mark team’s nail-biting win against Toronto Blue Jays The City of Angels erupted in celebration following the Los Angeles Dodgers’ nail-biting, seven game World Series win . Angelenos joined fans around the world in jubilation as the Dodg

Shohei Ohtani and the rest of the Los Angeles Dodgers celebrated their second straight World Series championship with a downtown parade Monday after becoming the first team in 25 years to win back-to-back titles.
The Los Angeles Dodgers celebrated their second consecutive title in front of their adoring fans.
titles: WATCH:  LA Dodgers fans take to streets to celebrate World Series win
LA erupts in celebration after Dodgers clinch second World Series victory
Dodgers celebrate back-to-back World Series titles with downtown parade

summary: The Los Angeles Dodgers won their second consecutive World Series, defeating the Toronto Blue Jays in a seven-game series. Celebrations erupted in Los Angeles, with fans gathering in the streets and at Dodger Stadium. The victory was marked by a downtown parade, highlighting the team's achievement as the first in 25 years to win back-to-back championships.

title: 6.3-Magnitude Earthquake Strikes Northern Afghanistan, 20 Dead, 600+ Injured
snippets: Powerful 6.3 earthquake hits northern Afghanistan, killing 20 and damaging historic Blue Mosque AP News
Powerful earthquake of magnitude 6.3 shakes northern Afghanistan, killing at least 20 people and injuring more than 500.
The Blue Mosque of Mazar-e-Sharif which dates back to the 15th century was affected by the earthquake. At least 20 people were killed and more than 600 were injured, according to authorities.

A 6.3-magnitude earthquake struck near the northern Afghan city of Mazar-e Sharif early on Monday, killing at least 20 people, injuring hundreds and damaging the city's historic Blue Mosque, authorities said, with the death toll likely to rise.
titles: Powerful 6.3 earthquake hits northern Afghanistan, killing 20 and damaging historic Blue Mosque - AP News
Deadly earthquake hits northern Afghanistan
Afghanistan's historic Blue Mosque damaged by earthquake
Deadly 6.3-magnitude earthquake hits northern Afghanistan
summary: A 6.3-magnitude earthquake hit northern Afghanistan, near Mazar-e Sharif, causing at least 20 deaths and injuring over 600 people. The quake also damaged the historic 15th-century Blue Mosque. Authorities anticipate the death toll may rise.

He stated that he has directed the Pentagon to plan for potential intervention. This marks an escalation in his criticism of Nigeria's handling of religious persecution. The Nigerian government has denied these accusations, asserting that it does not condone violence against Christians.

title: Israel's Top Military Prosecutor Resigns, Arrested for Leaking Video

Israel has arrested Yifat Tomer-Yerushalmi over her leaking of a video showing Israeli soldiers abusing prisoners.
Yifat Tomer-Yerushalmi reportedly acknowledged that her office released video of troops abusing a Palestinian detainee.

Her actions have sparked controversy, with some rightwing figures labeling the soldiers as 'heroes' and denouncing military investigators.

title: Walt Weiss Named Atlanta Braves' New Manager, Succeeds Brian Snitker
snippets: The Braves on Monday hired Walt Weiss, who has been Atlanta's bench coach since 2018, as their new manager to replace Brian Snitker.
It's a busy offseason for managerial candidates
Weiss previously served as the Rockies manager for four seasons
The Atlanta Braves stayed in-house to find their latest skipper. Atlanta announced Monday that it has hired Walt Weiss to take over as the 49th manager in franchise history.

summary: The Atlanta Braves appointed Walt Weiss, their bench coach since 2018 and former Rockies manager, as their new manager, replacing Brian Snitker. Weiss becomes the 49th manager in the franchise's history, marking an internal promotion within the team's coaching ranks.

Anthony Williams, 32, has been charged with attempted murder related to the train attack. The incidents all occurred over the same weekend, raising questions about their interconnection.

Northern provinces of Balkh and Samangan worst hit by magnitude 6.3 quake, which also damaged Mazar-i-Sharif’s Blue Mosque A powerful 6.3 magnitude earthquake shook northern Afghanistan before dawn on Monday, killing at least 20 people and injuring more than 640 others, 25 critically, a disaster man
The 6.3-magnitude earthquake struck near the city of Mazar-e-Sharif, the U.S. Geological Survey said. The full extent of the damage was not immediately known.

title: Leucine Boosts Mitochondrial Efficiency, New Generator Harvests Rain Energy
snippets: Scientists uncovered how the amino acid leucine enhances mitochondrial efficiency by preserving crucial proteins that drive energy production. By downregulating the protein SEL1L, leucine prevents unnecessary degradation and strengthens the cell’s power output. The findings link diet directly to mit

A new water-integrated droplet electricity generator produces high electrical output while floating on water surfaces. Raindrops are not only a source of fresh water, they also carry unused energy that falls naturally from the sky. Scientists have long explored ways to convert this falling water int
titles: Scientists discover the nutrient that supercharges cellular energy
Scientists Develop Floating Device That Harvests Energy From Raindrops
summary: Scientists discovered that the amino acid leucine improves mitochondrial efficiency by protecting proteins essential for energy production, specifically by inhibiting the protein SEL1L, which leads to enhanced cellular energy output. Additionally, researchers developed a water-integrated droplet electricity generator that can produce electricity by floating on water surfaces, utilizing the energy from falling raindrops. This advancement links diet to mitochondrial function and presents a new method for generating electrical energy from rain.

title: Hektoria Glacier Retreats 25km, Debate Over Sea Level Impact Ensues
snippets: A new study suggests that changes to Hektoria Glacier are unprecedented - but not all scientists agree.
Hektoria glacier on the Antarctic Peninsula retreated 25 kilometres in just 15 months. Its rapid melt could have implications for other glaciers and the rate of sea level rise

summary: A study reports that Hektoria Glacier in the Antarctic Peninsula retreated 25 kilometers in 15 months, indicating rapid melting that could affect sea level rise. However, not all scientists concur with the findings' implications, suggesting that the changes might not be unprecedented.

title: Orcas Filmed Hunting Great White Sharks in Gulf of California
snippets: For the first time, video footage has captured orcas in the Gulf of California hunting young great white sharks, using a trick to flip them over, paralise them and get at their energy-rich livers
An orca pod that made headlines last year for gutting a whale shark has struck again, this time perfecting a technique that involves paralyzing young great white sharks to eat their livers.
titles: Orcas are ganging up on great white sharks to eat their livers
Orcas in the Gulf of California paralyze young great white sharks before ripping out their livers
summary: For the first time, video in the Gulf of California shows orcas hunting young great white sharks by flipping them to paralyze and consume their livers. This follows previous behavior of targeting a whale shark, indicating a pattern of sophisticated hunting techniques by the orca pod.

title: Smart Locks Boost Home Security; Gaming Laptops Diversify in Design

titles: I tested 30 smart locks, and these are the best
I tested a bunch of gaming laptops and these are the best
summary: Smart locks offer a convenient solution for common issues like getting locked out or needing to grant access remotely, enhancing home security and convenience. Meanwhile, gaming laptops vary in design, with options ranging from bulky, high-performance models with extensive cooling systems and RGB lighting to sleeker, lighter versions aimed at a more general audience.

The best iPad deals you can get right now
summary: Apple's AirPods and iPads are frequently available at discounted prices, including models like the AirPods Max, AirPods 4, and the second-gen AirPods Pro with USB-C. Significant sales often occur during events like Prime Day, Black Friday, and Cyber Monday, but day-to-day discounts are also common, offering savings outside these major sales events.
